map.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: a drawing of a particular area, for example a city or country, which shows its main features, such as its roads, rivers, mountains etc
map.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: According to the map we should turn left.
Iâ€™m just trying to find Vancouver on the map.
map.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: a drawing of an area showing some kind of special feature, for example the type of rocks, weather, population etc
map.translation[0].definitions[1].note.t: political map (=one showing where political parties have power, or where countries are)
map.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: an archaeological map of the area
the colour weather map in the newspaper
map.translation[0].note_box[0].sections[: She stopped the car to look at the map.
He drove while I read the map.
They studied the map before setting out.
He drew me a map of the route.
I don't know how to get to Berlin without consulting a map.
The path is clearly marked on the map.
I managed to find the village on the map.
We spread out our maps on the floor.
a detailed map of the city
a modern, accurate map of the district
There's a street map outside the town hall.
The museum is marked on most tourist maps.
Contours on the map are given in feet.
map.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: to make a map of a particular area
map.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: He spent the next fifteen years mapping the Isle of Anglesey.
map.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: to discover or show information about something, especially about its shape or arrangement, or how it moves or works
map.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: The points at which stress and anxiety emerge can be mapped.
